1242.sentence: "On Tuesday, July 16, Springsteen dedicated his protest song ``American Skin to the late teen Trayvon Martin at a concert in Limerick, Ireland. SWEDEN OUT The Associated Press Bruce Springsteen dedicated his protest song ``American Skin '' to teenager Trayvon Martin during a concert in Limerick, Ireland. In a video posted online, the 63-year-old singer told the crowd Tuesday: ``We'll send this as a letter back home for justice for Trayvon Martin'' after noticing a fan's sign that read ``American Skin.`` George Zimmerman was acquitted Saturday of second-degree murder and manslaughter charges in Martin's death. Zimmerman said he fired his gun in self-defense during a February 2012 confrontation with the 17-year-old in Sanford, Fla. Lyrics in the song include ''you can get killed just for living in your American skin.`` Springsteen wrote the song about the 1999 police shooting death of Guinean immigrant Amadou Diallo.",\\n
1242.headline: "Bruce Springsteen dedicates song to Trayvon Martin",\\n
